contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=August 2009}} {{Infobox settlement | official_name = Bydel Gamle Oslo | type = [[Districts of Oslo|District]] | image_shield = Oslo komm.svg | image_map = Oslo_gamleoslo.png | image_skyline = | latd = | latm = | lats = | latNS = N | longd = | longm= | longs= | longEW= E | coordinates_display = inline,title | coordinates_region = NO | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = [[Norway]] | subdivision_type2 = [[List of towns and cities in Norway|City]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Oslo]] | iso_code = [[ISO 3166-2:NO|NO-030101]] | leader_title = <!-- Governor --> | leader_name = | area_total_km2 = 7.45 | area_footnotes = | area_rank = | area_note = | population_as_of = 2004 | population_total = 34,140 | population_footnotes = | population_rank = | population_note = | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = [[Central European Time|CET]] | utc_offset1 = +1 | timezone1_DST = [[Central European Summer Time|CEST]] | utc_offset1_DST = +2 | website = [http://www.bgo.oslo.kommune.no/ bgo.oslo.kommune.no] }} '''Gamle Oslo''' is a [[districts of Oslo|district]] of the city of [[Oslo]], [[Norway]]. The name means "Old Oslo". The district has several landmarks and large parks, including the [[Edvard Munch]] Museum, the Botanical Gardens and a medieval park. During the time that present Oslo was named [[Oslo|Christiania]], this area was called Oslo. Neighborhoods of Oslo belonging to this district are: * [[Grønland (Street)|Grønland]] * [[Enerhaugen]] * [[Tøyen]] * [[Vålerenga]] * [[Kampen, Norway|Kampen]] * [[Gamlebyen (Oslo)|Gamlebyen]] * [[Ensjø]] * [[Etterstad]] * [[Valle-Hovin]] * [[Helsfyr]] * [[Ekebergskråningen]] The district also includes islands and islets in the [[Oslofjord]]: [[Kavringen]], [[Nakholmen]], [[Lindøya]], [[Hovedøya]], [[Bleikøya]], [[Gressholmen]], [[Rambergøya]], [[Langøyene]] and [[Heggholmen]]. In the municipal election of 2007 all district councils became elective, until then most had been appointed by the city council. Labour became the largest party with 5 representatives, the Socialist Left have 3, the Conservatives, Liberals and the Red Electoral Alliance 2 each, and the Progress party 1. == Gallery == <gallery> File:Svartdalsparken1.JPG|Svartdalsparken File:Peace Research Institute of Oslo.jpg|Office building of the Peace Research Institute of Oslo </gallery> {{Oslo}} {{coord missing|Norway}} [[Category:Boroughs of Oslo]] [[Category:Gamle Oslo| ]] {{Oslo-geo-stub}}
